attributes.action: Improve the treatment of asylum seekers and immigrants coming to the UK.
attributes.background: We believe that with help and support provided by the state asylum seekers and refugees can become just as much of as an asset to the UK. However, the treatment of these vulnerable individuals can only be changed through a shift in the Government's rhetoric and a change in British attitudes.
attributes.additional_details: Over the years the Government and the UK's attitudes towards asylum seekers and refugees have increasingly become more negative. The rhetoric that is pushed is one that pushes the idea of foreigners being somehow less valuable than those native to this country. We call on the Government to revisit and improve current policy.

attributes.action: Reclassify forced entry or attempted entry into a home as an act of terrorism.
attributes.background: The distress and terror caused by someone trying to force their way into your home is a much more real and likely occurence than any threat from those acts currently classified as terrorist. These acts, however, cause real feelings of terror in the victims with a long lasting sense of insecurity.
attributes.additional_details:
From the perspective of the victim, there are far fewer resources available for the detection and apprehension of the perpetrators than there appears to be for the equivalent action against those currently considered as terrorists.
Witnessing someone attempting to force entry to your home, leave and then return with a weapon to use in the event that you confront them is a very real and terror inducing prospect for many people in this country.
It MUST be accorded the appropriate seriousness.

attributes.action: Allow 14-15 year olds to consent to sex with someone a maximum of 3 years older
attributes.background: The age of consent is currently 16, and therefore those aged below 16 are prohibited from engaging in sexual; whether protected or unprotected. My proposal is that 14 year olds should be allowed to engage in sexual activity; but only protected, and with partners who are no more than 3 years older.
attributes.additional_details: The age of consent in the UK has been 16 since 1885. Sex education has improved since 1885, and so 14 year-olds nowadays are capable of consenting to safe sex and understand the implications. Most countries in Europe have a lower age of consent than we do, which has led to calls to reduce ours. However, I believe that this is a dangerous move with paedophilia being so common today, and so I believe that my proposal is the best option. Various US states follow legislation similar to my proposal.

attributes.action: All PMs must state that their duty is to enact the will of the people, not God.
attributes.background: All incoming PMs should be required to publicly confirm that their primary duty is to the electorate and to reaffirm their commitment to their election manifesto.
attributes.additional_details: This petition is not an attack on the right of acting MPs to hold personal religious beliefs. Rather, it is intended to remind our leaders that, in their public capacity, they are ultimately answerable to the electorate and that the manifesto commitments they've made to voters supersede the demands of their personal faith.

attributes.action: Create a report on cannabis legalisation worldwide
attributes.background:
Cannabis is being legalised and regulated worldwide, for recreational and medicinal use.

We need a full, detailed report which uses up to date science on any health benefits from cannabis and that also looks at the varying models of regulation of cannabis worldwide.

attributes.action: Make all school 'inset days' during 'half term' periods, to save childcare cost.
attributes.background: Schools in the UK typically have 6 holiday periods per year. During this time, many parents need to pay for additional childcare or take time off work. In addition to this, schools also take many add hoc inset days (teacher training days). This training should be done during half term periods.
attributes.additional_details:
Schools doing their training during the half term periods, would save millions of parents time, money and inconvenience. It's extremely difficult for full time working parents to accommodate those ad hoc days, when the school is closed to pupils. 

The school building should be utilised during the half term periods for teacher training, as this is not only convenient for parents, but would be a better use of the school facilities, many of which are paid for with public tax money.

attributes.action: Increase Defence Spending to 2.5% of GDP.
attributes.background: NATO guidelines put 2% of GDP as the minimum defence spending for NATO countries. I point out the key word: MINIMUM. 2% is the bare minimum. It is not a "target". We must endeavour to bring our capabilities back up to adequate standards after careless, thoughtless cuts in the SDSR 2010 & 2015.
attributes.additional_details: It is a simple fact that when HMS Queen Elizabeth comes into service 13 Frigates and 6 Destroyers simply won't be adequate to form a Carrier Group whilst maintaining other global operations. We require AT LEAST 8 Type 26's, 12 T-31's and another 2 Destroyers. The RAF can only muster a pathetic 36 Jets whilst Saudi was deploying 100+ daily in Yemen. We call for immediate action to boost spending to 2.5% of GDP as to regain basic, minimum capability as quickly & efficiently as possible.

attributes.action: Reverse the Government's decision to 'ban' Lettings Agency applicant/tenant fees
attributes.background: The decision by the Government to 'ban' applicant/tenant fees is poorly conceived and of little benefit to tenants or the economy of the UK. In addition, this 'ban' goes against the very grain/ideology of a 'free market' economy.
attributes.additional_details: The announced plans to 'ban' (outright) the ability for Lettings Agencies to charge fees to applicants/tenants is based on a fundamental misunderstanding by the government as to how Lettings Agencies/Landlords are required to operate. The Government implies that tenants do not have a choice as to which property they wish to rent or which agency they wish to use, which displays an inherent lack of understanding as to how the property industry functions and what is required of it.

attributes.action: Dedicate July 1st as a bank holiday in memory of princess Diana.
attributes.background: Princess Diana was a prominent member of British history and deserves to be remembered for her contributions to her charity work and her support of the International Campaign to ban landmines. This bank holiday could replace the Whitsun bank holiday.
attributes.additional_details: The Whitsun bank holiday has become outdated and lost its meaning to the general public. We propose that the Princess Diana bank holiday would be more suitable, as it's closer to the nations heart. Her continued support for Great Ormand Street and other charities has allowed her to become an iconic role model for younger generations to aspire to be like. July 1st marks her birthday and a bank holiday on this day would allow the British public to remember and celebrate her and her achievements.

attributes.action: Make it law that qualified electricians are allowed to break seals on cutouts
attributes.background: It is time that us electricians of which are highly trained and aware of electricity at work act do our jobs.
attributes.additional_details: Jobs can become more expensive and time consuming relying on an already over stretched national grid.  Just as BT had to open openreach allow electricians the right for basic electrical connections and force national grid to sell new seals.

attributes.action: The awareness of FGM (female genital mutilation) to increase in schools.
attributes.background: FGM is the practice of partially or totally removing the external genitalia. Until recently I had no idea what FGM was. i had no idea that girls all around the world could be suffering from FGM. When people explained it to me I was horrified.
attributes.additional_details: Due to this more awareness should be given to students. This could help stop the practice of FGM in this country completely. FGM is still a big problem here even though it is illegal.

attributes.action: Special funding to Councils for social housing for adults with disabilities
attributes.background: Many local authorities have social housing problems... but more so for adults with physical disabilities and/or learning disabilities (who may require shared living). Where housing associations have stepped in to provide properties they charge rents far beyond what is affordable on housing benefit.
attributes.additional_details: Many social housing properties are in disadvantaged areas with high crime, making them unsafe for many adults with learning disabilities, or properties are ill suited for the person's physical disabilities... this results in many people having to continue living wth parents long into adulthood... with complex care needs that place unsustainable pressure on the family relationship increasing the risk of crisis or carer breakdown.

attributes.action: Move the Ministry for Exiting the EU to Northern England
attributes.background: It is important that the ministry has a good appreciation of the needs of the economy outside the S.E. of England where a great deal of the regeneration and products produced for export come from. It would help in the building confidence in and reinforcing the Northern Powerhouse.
attributes.additional_details: The re-balancing of the economy will be an important component of restructuring the economy after Brexit, the industrial areas of the north had traditionally been part of the successful rise of Britain as a global superpower.

attributes.action: Let the victims decide who should next head the Westminster abuse.inquiry.
attributes.background: Someone who is trusted or members of the public should put forward respectable candidates from which the victims should choose the head of the inquiry. The main qualification required by potential candidates is integrity.
attributes.additional_details: WE MUST HAVE ANSWERS

attributes.action: Present a draft UN resolution that would implement a no fly zone over Syria.
attributes.background: UK to call on all civilised nations of the world (via the United Nations) to draft a UN resolution that would implement a no fly zone over Syria and would apply to ALL aircraft of Syria, Russia, and lran for the purposes of military operations until the complete and total cessation of hostilities.
attributes.additional_details:
Over 3000,000 people have now lost their lives in this conflict. The UN has officially declared Aleppo as besieged. Russian and Syrian forces and their allies must not be allowed to continue to flout international law and bomb civilians, civilian infrastructure, hospitals and aid operations. Since the breakdown of the recent cease-fire on September 19 over 500 civilians have been killed in Aleppo alone, with at least 100 of those being children.
Sources: 
www.unicef.org
www.syriahr.com
and more

attributes.action: The Royal Marines Calendar should be allowed
attributes.background: Allow the Royal Marines to release thier annual calendar to raise money for essential charities. If the government cannot fund the charities the Royal Marines want to support, then allow them to raise the money by making a calendar!

attributes.action: Stop development of new fossil fuel reserves to comply with the Paris agreement.
attributes.background: See for example : https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2016/sep/27/fracking-digging-drilling-paris-agreement-fossil-fuels

attributes.action: Raise the fine for using a handheld device at the wheel to £1,000.
attributes.background: The Press states that the fine for using a handheld device at the wheel will be doubled from £100 to £200.   For a car owner / driver this is ridiculously small.   I believe that the Government should raise the fine for such dangerous behaviour to at least £1,000.   Breaking this law should hurt!

attributes.action: Government should put a stop to paying of TV licence in the UK!!
attributes.background:
Government should put a stop to paying of tv licence because is not acceptable!
I have lived in spain and other parts of eu country and they don't ask their citizens to pay for TV licence. 
You can make research for yourself.
attributes.additional_details: Most eu countries don't ask for TV licence.

attributes.action: Scrap HS2, and build the best internet system in the world instead.
attributes.background: HS2 makes no difference to the vast majority and solves old world issues. The disruption over a long period make the cost uncertain, with little benefit to the vast majority of the public and industry. Let's build the very best internet instead and make the UK the worlds leading tech nation instead!
attributes.additional_details:
Fixing overcrowded railways will turn out way same as fixing overcrowded motorways, the more you build the more crowded they become. With driverless cars around the corner, let's jump a stage ahead and move commercial traffic to the railway system and focus on making commercial communication better with the best internet the world has seen so far.
We and the next wave of innovators would all benefit from the side effect of hyper fast and super efficient internet in ways not even thought of yet.

attributes.action: Change to Western European time to take advantage of 1hr extra evening daylight
attributes.background: Conversion to Western European time would give one hour additional evening daylight throughout the year. Western France, much of Spain and all of Portugal are to the west of the UK and yet they are 1hr ahead. It would also have a business advantage of harmonising UK time with Western Europe.

attributes.action: Allow MOD personnel to cook meals within SLA using issued or personal appliances
attributes.background: Safety regulations have resulted in the banning of any cooking appliances other than microwave and toaster within SLA. This makes PAYD the only option on camps for eating a hot meal, allowing for monopoly by contractors. Personnel should be allowed the option of cooking their own meals if they wish.

attributes.action: DWP: decision to extend the waiting time for Mortgage payment to 39 weeks!
attributes.background:
If you get laid off / paid off / made redundant and have a mortgage – you have to wait 39 Weeks before the DWP will make any payment to your lender? 
This is a disgrace – It used to be 13 Weeks wait before April of this year, which was bad enough, but now 9 Months – how are people meant to survive?
attributes.additional_details:
What are the government thinking abouts? 
Do they want to make people homeless? They would then be responsible for housing them.
There is a severe lack of social housing – and this will just add to the crisis. Social housing will cost 3-4 times the amount of the mortgage!

SMI: Support for Mortgage Interest 
https://www.gov.uk/support-for-mortgage-interest/what-youll-get

attributes.action: Give British people a say in our post-referendum relationship with the EU
attributes.background: The EU referendum gave the option of leaving or remaining in the EU. The options in reality are more nuanced and there is a risk of the British populace getting an unsatisfactory outcome. Given the lies of the pre-referendum campaigning we need honesty about the future of Britain and further say.
attributes.additional_details:
We need to know, and have a say on:
Whether further austerity measures might be necessary after leaving the EU: www.just-fair.co.uk/#!United-Nations-Austerity-policies-breach-the-UK%E2%80%99s-international-human-rights-obligations/qbw0c/577384fa0cf231749dc9f955
How immigration will be affected www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-37271420
Whether the NHS will be better off by £350 million per week
Whether the United Kingdom will split up
How our successful science base will be protected

attributes.action: Return Tier 1 Skilled Migrant visa for professionals of shortage occupation list
attributes.background: Currently there is a shortage occupation list which is well documented. Regardless of this shortage occupation list, the complex process for Tier 2 visa is a deterrent for companies to recruit even the perfect professional candidate from outside of the EU. UK thus loses the best to other EU nations!
attributes.additional_details: https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/486107/Shortage_Occupation_List_-_November_2015.pdf

attributes.action: Increase tax allowance to £14,976 per year so minimum wage pay no tax on income
attributes.background: We believe this would encourage people back into full time employment whilst reducing benefits claims to a degree. This action may influence our economy as there would be potential for more disposable income.

attributes.action: Use UK National Lottery to support the NHS and Care homes.
attributes.background: It's distressing to read and hear about the problems with our NHS services and the closures of Care Facilities and Homes for the Elderly, such distress can only continue for so many if these problems persist.
attributes.additional_details: Alternatively, why also doesn't the government introduce a NHS Lottery which is solely for the running of the NHS and associated causes like care for the elderly?

attributes.action: Allow the public to "vote out" members of the house of Lords.
attributes.background: The membership of the House of Lords needs to be reduced in size. A directly elected House of Lords would vie with the House of Commons as being representative of the people and has been rejected by the government. As a compromise the electorate should be allowed to choose which peers are sacked.

attributes.action: Delay Article 50 until impact of Brexit is clear, then consult the people again.
attributes.background: The question oversimplified the issue and was open to interpretation. The Government took the result as a mandate to exit at any cost. A "hard Brexit" will damage the economy and may break up the UK. The result was too close to justify this. Opinion polls suggest a different result if run today.
attributes.additional_details:
A recent ITV poll suggests that 12% of people would change their vote if the referendum was run again. This exceeds the margin of the Leave result in the Referendum
http://www.itv.com/news/update/2017-02-17/how-do-you-feel-about-brexit-vote-now/

attributes.action: Devote some of the UK's aid budget to supporting Ugandan LGBT refugees in Kenya.
attributes.background: Homophobic laws in Uganda cause many LGBT people to seek refuge in Kenya where they apply for refugee status. Even in Kenya they are persecuted and subject to police brutality and often become destitute while their asylum claims are processed. They despirately need safe accommodation and food.
attributes.additional_details:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/LGBT_rights_in_Nigeria

http://www.ibtimes.co.uk/meet-lgbti-ugandan-community-living-fear-kenyas-kakuma-refugee-camp-1566516

http://www.huffingtonpost.com/the-groundtruth-project/inside-the-nightmares-of_b_7674502.html

attributes.action: Demand a stop to potential closure of Glenfield children's heart unit
attributes.background: The children's heart unit at Glenfield Hospital is being threatened with closure. If this is carried out, what would it mean for some children? How might they cope in a situation of having no hospital near them to go to in an emergency?

attributes.action: Ban gambling and live odds advertising during sports broadcasts.
attributes.background: With the explosion of the Premier League, a similar and more sinister growth has taken place, that of online gambling. A gambling addiction can ruin families and lives and with smartphones accessible 24/7, it has never been easier to gamble.
attributes.additional_details: The government has banned smoking adverts yet betting companies are still allowed to advertise, with a 600% increase from 2006-2012 and children as young as 4 being exposed to 200 adverts a year. This creates a sense that gambling is part of life and everybody is doing it whereas in reality it can become dangerous. We are not asking for a ban on gambling, all we want is to separate the enjoyment of sport from the dangers of gambling, by banning gambling adverts during the broadcast of sport.

attributes.action: Fathers to receive the same full paternity pay just the same as mothers.
attributes.background: Currently the government say fathers should only be entitled to 2 weeks paternity leave and £139.58 per week or 90% of weekly average earnings. Whichever is LOWER! Why can't fathers have the same rights to receive full pay like mothers!

attributes.action: Give early years teachers (with EYTS) the same rights for pay as those with QTS.
attributes.background: EYTs have to pass the same skills test and interviews to qualify onto the course, and meet and pass against the same amount of standards and assessments as those with QTS. Therefore rights for starting pay should be the same, and the professionalism of the early years should be further recognised.
attributes.additional_details: Get into teaching (https://getintoteaching.education.gov.uk/funding-and-salary/teacher-salaries) states 'As a newly qualified teacher you’ll begin on a salary of at least £22,467, or £28,098 in inner London. As you rise up the pay ranges, you could earn as much as £115,582 as a head...' However on the same web page it states an unqualified teacher can receive a minimum of £16,461. Early Years Teachers are currently viewed as 'unqualified' despite the vigorous post graduate year training.

attributes.action: Burglaries should attract a minimum of a five year prison sentence.
attributes.background: Ordinary citizens are having homes and businesses burgled or cars taken under threat of violence. It is time the judiciary put our safety and well-being above the offender. Hand out lengthy prison sentences and provide in-prison rehabilitation programmes to break the offenders criminal cycle.
attributes.additional_details: Then,following prison release criminals should be made to pay for the cost of their prison stay even if they are on benefits. Make them pay a minimum of £5 per week.

attributes.action: Instead of inviting Donald Trump for state visit, redirect funding to NHS
attributes.background: Instead of inviting Donald Trump for state visit, redirect funds to much needed NHS

attributes.action: I want a BAN on any child under 10 being allowed their ears pieced.
attributes.background: So by law if you were to put holes in another human beings body without permission then you'd be arrested for bodily harm, but parents believe they have the right to be doing this to babies and children, why can't a child have the right to ask for it to be done and choose to ruin their own bodies.
attributes.additional_details: A child starts hitting puberty around 10 which is when there body starts forming and it wouldn't make too much difference in piercing their ears. They'd be less likely to quickly move or cause damage or infection and you'd know there allergies (I.e Gold) by then, a child should be able to ask, especially as if they choose they don't like them they'll be left with either holes or scars on their ears all because there parents pierced them without permission while so young. It's assault.

attributes.action: Ban Employment Agencies
attributes.background:
Employment Agencies exploit workers by acting as middle men to real jobs, they take cuts from already terrible wages, and have ruined chances for secure employment for British Nationals.

This drives down the UK living standards, work life balance, and makes it tougher to get real employment.
attributes.additional_details:
Companies that employ staff also exploit Employment Agencies as they pay agencies less money than they would pay their staff to get work done. Companies don't have to employ agency workers as staff, even when the workers do a fantastic job.

Some agency workers even come from different countries, and are happy to work for pittance as their foreign value of money is less than ours in the UK.

This is extremely unfair and unethical for for British Nationals in their own country.

attributes.action: Equip all police officers with firearms on and off duty to deal with terror.
attributes.background: Equip all police officers with firearms on and off duty to deal with terror threats promptly with no waiting time for specialist units to attend the scene. Increase the fitness standard of all police officers and provide all officers firearms training. Only equip officers that meet the standard.

attributes.action: Introduce a 'political awareness test' to allow minors to qualify for the vote.
attributes.background: This idea arrived after the recent Brexit-Bremain debate when many minors felt their vote would have impacted the descision to stay or leave the European Union. The idea is also inspired by the positive impact 16 and 17 year olds had on the Scottish Refferendum. The test would allow minors to vote.
attributes.additional_details: Introduce a political awareness test which would allow citizens under the age of 18 to vote (after qualifying) in all forms of election across the UK. A test like this would eliminate the argument that minors do not know politics and therefore can't be trusted with the vote. If the minor was to pass the test, proving there awareness of politics, then they would qualify to have the ability to vote in any domestic election before age 18. The default voting age will still remain at 18.

attributes.action: Overhaul the honours system, so only selfless acts of compassion are rewarded
attributes.background: Famous people, people in power and people with money shouldn't get on the honours just because they're in those positions. It's prejudicial. They need to earn it, doing things outside their normal jobs, helping people and the community within our country. Otherwise the honours are meaningless.
attributes.additional_details: The list should be for those who help protect the country and support it outside of their paid duties. Just being rich or doing a job you're paid to do shows innate produce prejudice for the elite. We should encourage compassion and community spirit and love of our country, but the current system teaches us that if you're in the elite, or you're friends with the PM, that's all that matters. It's not supposed to be there as the PM's private thank you card.

attributes.action: Give Au Pairs employment rights in the UK.
attributes.background: Au pairs come to the UK to learn English and experience a new culture living in with a family. In return for ones accommodation, one will help in the home and with the children for a small 'pocket money' token. In reality, this is a job and should have employment rights like all other employment.
attributes.additional_details: The laws for Au Pairs & Host Families need addressing as they are non-existent. AP's can work in excess of 60 hours per week, being paid anything from £35 per week, with no paid holiday or right to minimum wage. The Gov states AP's ''are unlikely to be classed as a worker or an employee.'' But why? A Nanny or cleaner are entitled to employment rights so why not AP's? It will protect both host families and AP's to have employment law to fall back on should either side need it down the line.

attributes.action: Theresa May MUST make statement to Parliament if Trump visit Petition rejected.
attributes.background: If Theresa May rejects the Petition to ban Trump on the grounds of "It would "undo everything" achieved in talks with Donald Trump" she MUST make a statement to Parliament to explain EXACTLY what she achieved on her visit to the US and why banning Trump would put that at risk.

attributes.action: Temporarily ban breeding of domestic animals until UK pet crisis is manageable.
attributes.background: We believe preventing breeding of domestic animals for monetary gain will decrease the number of animals living in cages. Why when there are so many animals without homes are we letting people keep breeding more?. They clearly have no thought for the animals, just the money they can make.
attributes.additional_details:
It is our societies decisions that have led to the number of abandoned animals increasing year on year. Rescue centres are overwhelmed  and it is our responsibility to change this.
102,363 stray and abandoned dogs were handled by local Authorities between 2014-2015, and the RSPCA alone rescued almost 119,000 animals.

attributes.action: Make it law to wear helmets on bicycles skateboards and roller skates
attributes.background: To many fatal injuries that could be avoided if a helmet was worn
attributes.additional_details: Most children in the UK think it is a bit silly to wear helmets. In New Zealand it is the law to wear safety helmets if you are on any thing with wheels and as it is the law no child seems to mind wearing them.

attributes.action: Increase funding for the NHS!
attributes.background: Our NHS is in crisis at the moment! Some patients are waiting in corridors on trolleys for hours, waiting for treatment. Nothing is currently being done about it, yet it is risking numerous peoples lives. 1,000's of surgeries are being cancelled. PLEASE SIGN TO SAVE THE NHS AND INCREASE SPENDING!
attributes.additional_details: The NHS is an amazing service which allows free healthcare for all and saves millions of lives each year! Each year, especially during winter, there is a struggle for resources but this year it is a lot worse than usual and risking patients lives. Thousands of surgeries are being cancelled due to there being no beds available which could be causing a persons life expectancy to drop dramatically. PLEASE SIGN THIS TO SAVE OUR NHS!

attributes.action: UK Government to hand control of the Severn bridges to the Welsh Assembly.
attributes.background: Control of the Severn bridges needs to be handed to the Welsh Assembly, who have unanomously voted to abolish the tolls. This would greatly help the Welsh economy.

attributes.action: Urgent review of Royal Navy capabilities, with immediate action on results.
attributes.background:
The Harrier Jet was scrapped by the UK in 2010, (USA will scrap them in 2025). Our last Aircraft Carrier was scrapped in 2016.
The replacement will enter service possibly in 2020.
I want our Government to immediately find a solution to this massive capability gap and implement it without delay.
attributes.additional_details:
The Harrier Jump Jet was scrapped in 2010 (USA will scrap them in 2025).  Our last Aircraft Carrier was scrapped in 2016.
No replacement has yet entered service. The MOD accountants have left this once great Maritime Nation defenceless. Utter madness to dispose of essential defence equipment before the replacement has been thoroughly trialled and allowed to enter service.
I want our Government to immediately find a solution to this massive capability gap and implement it without delay.

attributes.action: Introduce ecig workplace regulations to stop discrimination against vaping
attributes.background: Hundreds of workplaces are rightly, making policies to include ecigs. The trouble is that some policies are stating that vaping must be in smoking shelters. It is putting vapers at risk and forcing them off the premises to remain smoke free when the smokers have a shelter.
attributes.additional_details: Vaping is not smoking, therefore vapers should have their own rights and not be discriminated against or put at risk of passive smoking.

attributes.action: Pay Special Guardianship carers the same rate as foster carers.
attributes.background: We both work full time jobs but almost 50% of my partners annual salary goes on child care cost. We should not have to be financially punished for wanting to work or cover the cost in traveling to arrange visits with the natural birth parents.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.communitycare.co.uk/2015/07/23/special-guardianship-orders-misused/
